# Draft:King Cole (Rapper)

that are , intellectually independent of each other, and . To properly create such a draft page, please see the articles  ‘Your First Article’,  ‘Referencing for Beginners’ and  ‘Easier Referencing for Beginners’. In short, "notability" requires reliable sources about the subject, rather than by the subject.
Please note that many of the references would appear to be from sources that are NOT considered  for establishing notability and should be removed (including blogs, company websites, press releases, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, Spotify etc).
Additionally, the draft tends to read too much like a promotional CV, which Wikipedia is not; and contains prose that is not of a standard appropriate for an encyclopaedia (also see WP:PEACOCK).
Thank you for declaring your conflict of interest.
Please familiarise yourself with these pages before amending the draft. If you feel you can meet these requirements, then please make the necessary amendments before resubmitting the page. It would help our volunteer reviewers by identifying, on the draft's talk page, the WP:THREE best sources that establish notability of the subject.
It would also be helpful if you could please identify with specificity, exactly which criteria you believe the page meets (eg "I think the page now meets WP:MUSICBIO criteria #3, because XXXXX").
Once you have implemented these suggestions, you may also wish to leave a note for me on my talk page, including the name of the draft page, and I would be happy to reassess. Cabrils (talk) 02:23, 12 August 2025 (UTC)}}
----
King Cole (born Cole Williams) is an American hip hop artist, comedian, and entertainer from the Pittsburgh–Ohio Tri-State area. Active since the mid 2010s, he is known for combining futuristic, space-themed production with lyrical storytelling, comedic elements, and cross-genre experimentation. Williams has released more than 140 songs, performed internationally, developed independent video games, and appeared in both independent and studio film and television productions. His work has been covered in multiple domestic and international media outlets, including WKBN 27, Zillions Magazine, Freim TV, ExtravaFrench, and HypeFresh.
Early life
Williams grew up in the Ohio–Pittsburgh Tri-State region. Influenced by hip hop artists such as Outkast, 2 Pac , and Eminem, as well as stand-up comedy and science fiction, he began writing and performing music in his teens.
Career
Music
Williams began recording original material in the mid 2010s, developing a style that blends personal reflection, science fiction motifs, and humor. His discography spans hip hop, experimental rap, and space-themed concept songs.
He has performed in venues across the United States and internationally, including Tokyo’s Ruby Room in Shibuya. His projects frequently extend beyond music; for example, releasing integrated music with non-fungible tokens (NFTs).
In 2025, Williams’ single In My Lane Make It Rain was reviewed by Zillions Magazine, which described it as "a journey of ambition and focus". That same year, his single Let’s Fly was covered by HypeFresh, which characterized it as "an inspiring journey of self-discovery and success".
His track Infinity was featured in Freim TV, which highlighted its cross-genre innovation and emotional depth. In 2024, his single Castle was the subject of an ExtravaFrench article that described it as "an ode to resilience in the world of hip hop".
Comedy
Alongside his music career, Williams has performed hundreds of stand-up comedy shows, often blending observational humor, surreal scenarios, and audience interaction. He has hosted multiple benefit events and participated in collaborative creative projects.
Film and television
Williams has worked in the independent film industry as both a performer and collaborator. He was part of a filmmaking team that won Best Film of Pittsburgh. His screen credits include background appearances in the Paramount+ series Mayor of Kingstown, Ethan Coen’s feature film Drive-Away Dolls, and the Showtime series American Rust.
In 2018, he was featured on the reality television series Flea Market Fanatics, where he was introduced as "The Book Man", reflecting his work as a rare and collectible book dealer. The appearance was covered by the local news outlet WKBN 27.
Other ventures
Williams operates Best Little Book House, an online bookstore specializing in rare books, art, and collectibles, currently hosted on eBay. He also works in photography and drone operation.
Discography
(partial list)
* Infinity
* Stars Align
* Superman Superplan
* Glitch in the Code
* In My Lane Make It Rain
* President
* Flying Cars
* Spacewalk
* Castle
* Let’s Fly
Awards and recognition
* Best Film of Pittsburgh — as part of a collaborative filmmaking team
* Multiple international performances, including Tokyo’s Ruby Room
